jobs.job_title: Registered Nurse - Lady Lake - Orlando, FL
jobs.description:
Vironix Health is among the fastest growing Ai-Virtual Care Mgmt companies in the globe. We are looking for a Florida-Licensed RN (or Compact License) who is passionate about healthcare and addressing preventable health deterioration resulting from chronic illness. This job is flexible and also offers amazing growth opportunities to folks interested in expanding their skill set to include AI-healthcare technologies. Vironix does business principally with physician practices as we provide preventative care in the form of remote physiologic monitoring, chronic care mgmt, principal care mgmt, and remote therapeutic monitoring. You will be responsible for:
Executing remote chronic care mgmt of patients with chronic lung, heart, kidney, and endocrinological conditions.
Setting up and maintaining care mgmt plans 
Physiologic data monitoring and analysis
Recruiting & Onboarding patients at rotating physician sites
Interacting with patients to ensure compliance with care plans.
Working together with MAs and other physiologic monitoring staff to deliver whole-person care. 
Developing product documentation and communicating with Vironix customers (clinics, hospitals, and individual providers).
Developing deep expertise on the mobile/web software and hardware associated with Vironix patient monitoring technology. 
Developing powerpoint presentations and participating in internal/customer meetings. 

The big upside to working at Vironix is that you not only get to work with the world's best talent but you also get unlimited growth potential professionally as part of a highly innovative startup looking to change the world. 
As a chronic care mgmt, clinical monitoring and product execution specialist with Vironix, you will work intimately with both physicians and patients. Internally, you will report to senior medical staff and customer success associates to provide feedback on patient health outcomes, user adoption, product quality, and customer satisfaction. 

Major Job Responsibilities:

Must have certification as a RN, NP, PA, or MD.
Must be able to execute chronic care mgmt and remote physiologic monitoring activities through the Vironix web app software. 
Must have experience with and interest in direct patient interactions and facilitating communication between patients and medical specialists
Must have strong computer skills (microsoft office, google docs/sheets/slides, web browsing, and familiarity with web/mobile applications)
Must have experience in administering, gathering, and reviewing data. 
Must have Strong writing and communication skills.
Must take responsibility for clinical monitoring and be comfortable as an individual contributor (this is a job where hand holding will not happen). 
Should be interested in entrepreneurship and joining a startup as a core team member
Should have the ability to work in a fast-paced startup and rapidly innovate continuously. 

Bonus Preferences:

Experience with administering physiologic measurements
A US compact license in addion to a California License.
Experience with programming and software/hardware troubleshooting
An interest in technology, machine learning, and AI. 

Benefits:

Flexible schedule and performance compensation package can either bring about higher end salaries for effective employees or be used as a part-time supplement for an existing job.
Performance-based bonuses
Opportunity to join a fast-growing, industry disrupting team

🌎 Vironix is based in Austin,TX

https://www.vironix.ai/

Contact: sswami@vironix.ai

jobs.company: Servant's Heart Home Health Services, Inc.
jobs.description:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing care to patients while adhering to compliance standards. This candidate should be able to recognize patient needs and prioritize those needs with the needs outlined by physicians. 
 Responsibilities
Assure quality care by adhering to standards set by the physicians
Provide care education to patients in person or over the phone
Adhere to compliance guidelines throughout processes (OSHA, FDA, HIPAA)

Qualifications

Must be a Registered Professional Nurse with current licensure
CPR, ACLS, and BCLS Certification
Knowledge of OSHA, FDA, and HIPAA compliance
Candidate must be able to lift and position patients on endoscopy stretcher and transport patients

Large hospital, part of a health system in the Los Angeles area is seeking an RN, Director of Case Management. The Director will have a team of about 25 in the department, encompassing, RNs and Social Workers and including a Manager of TCase Management. Candidates outside of California will be considered. The Director of Case Management will report to the Regional CM Director and Chief Medical Officer. 

Responsibilities:
The Director will have direct function and personnel responsibility for the care management department.
Will develop, manage and oversee the annual case management budget.
Will prepare and evaluate monthly, quarterly, and annual reports of the department's functions. 
Monitor and report on changes in Medicare regulations and documentation issues to physicians and others as needed.
Maintain relationships and contractual oversight with key stakeholders, and local, state, and federal agencies.

Qualifications
BSN required. Master's Degree preferred.
At least 5 years in leadership is required.

Salary and Benefits:
Excellent benefits
Competitive salary, plus bonus, and sign-on bonus.

Job Opportunity: RNs, CNAs, and LVNs for In-Home 24/7 Care Team in Houston (River Oaks)
We are seeking experienced and compassionate RNs, CNAs, and LVNs to join a dedicated 24/7/365 in-home healthcare team for a family member in the River Oaks area of Houston. This role is ideal for professionals passionate about providing high-quality, continuous, personalized care in a home setting.

Responsibilities:
Deliver patient-centered care in a private home environment
Work collaboratively within a team of independent contractors and agency personnel
Assure quality care by adhering to standards set by physicians
Recognize and prioritize patient needs alongside physician-outlined care plans
Provide care education to patients in person or over the phone
Ensure compliance with OSHA, FDA, and HIPAA guidelines throughout all processes

Compensation:
For RNs (based on skill set and education):
$45–$55/hr regular weekday
$50–$61/hr weekend and night shifts
$67.50–$82.50/hr overtime
$75–$91.50/hr weekend and night overtime
For LVNs:
$44/hr regular weekday and weekend/night shifts
$66/hr overtime
Qualifications:
Active RN, CNA, or LVN license in Texas
Registered Professional Nurse with current licensure (for RN candidates)
CPR, ACLS, and BCLS Certification required for RNs
Knowledge of OSHA, FDA, and HIPAA compliance
Ability to lift and position patients on endoscopy stretchers and transport patients
Experience in home health or private care settings preferred
Strong commitment to patient well-being and team collaboration
To Apply:
Contact Caroline at caroline.mitchell@jkjllc.com.
This is a unique opportunity to be part of a supportive team dedicated to excellence in long-term care. If you’re interested in making a difference and bringing your expertise to this role, please apply!

Job Overview:
NewHealth MD is seeking a dedicated and experienced bilingual (Spanish/English) Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner (ARNP) to join our growing team at our clinic in Lawrenceville, GA. This role involves providing high-quality primary care services to our patients. The position offers the flexibility to practice within the clinic or perform remote consultations, depending on your preference.
Who We Are:
NewHealth MD is a growing network of primary care clinics in the United States specializing in Medicare Advantage and ACA plans. We leverage our 30+ years of industry experience and a broad network across 33 states to deliver tailored services while utilizing state-of-the-art technology for the best patient outcomes.
Responsibilities:
Provide comprehensive primary care services to patients.
Diagnose and manage acute and chronic health conditions.
Prescribe medications and therapies as appropriate.
Educate patients on wellness, prevention, and early detection of health issues.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to ensure optimal patient outcomes.
Remain up to date and ensure compliance with national, state, and local healthcare laws and regulations.
Qualifications:
Current and unrestricted Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner (ARNP) license in Georgia.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in primary care or a related field.
Strong diagnostic skills and comprehensive understanding of medical best practices.
Compassionate, patient-centered care approach with excellent communication skills.
Schedule:
Full-Time.
What We Offer:
Competitive pay.
Comprehensive benefits package.
Training and continuing education credits.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.

JOB DESCRIPTION: 
Responsible and accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, and evaluating nursing care of assigned patient. Responsible and accountable for supervising and delegating care and tasks to other personnel. Assigned patients may vary in age for infancy through geriatrics. jobs.job_title: Labor and Delivery RN (L&D Registered Nurse)
jobs.description:
PRN Medical Solutions is seeking a skilled and compassionate Labor and Delivery Nurse (L&D RN) to join our team. As a Labor and Delivery Nurse (L&D RN), you will play a crucial role in providing care and support to expectant mothers during the labor and delivery process.

Location: Riverside

Responsibilities:
Monitor the progress of labor, including fetal heart rate, contraction patterns, and maternal vital signs
Administer medications as prescribed by the physician 200 deliveries a month
Newborn role at delivery, and PP couplet care
4 antepartum rooms, 9 labor / high risk, 3 triage
Needs to be able to work in an OR suite during C-section (standard equipment)

Requirements
1 year minimum of recent experience in specialty
ACLS, BLS, NRP, AWHONN (advanced)

Join our team of dedicated healthcare professionals and make a difference in the lives of mothers and their newborns. Apply today to become a valued member of our Labor and Delivery team! #RN #Labor #Delivery #LaborandDelivery #RegisteredNurse #LA #OC #Riverside #employment

NOTE: This in an in-office role in Pittsburgh, PA, USA. 
 >> ABOUT YINZCAM 
We build mobile apps that are used by 200+ professional sports clubs in the NFL, NBA, MLS, NHL, EPL (U.K.), Liga MX, AFL (Australia), and more. 

>> THE ROLE.
We are looking for a sports-minded Graphic Designer who has a passion for graphic design, user-centered design, typography, and visual storytelling for sports.

This is a design-heavy role. 
This is a deadline-intense role. 
This is a fast-paced role. 
This is a self-learner role. 
This is a customer-centric role. 
This is an onsite, in-person role. 

>> THE RESPONSIBILITIES. 

As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for: 

Delivering high-fidelity sports-centric graphic designs for mobile apps to our sports clubs.
Using the YinzCam Content Management System (CMS) to support all of our clients.
Learning the YinzCam platform and features, quickly and independently, to become a subject-matter expert.
Creating multiple mobile "looks" for our clients, including game-day looks, non-gameday looks, Draft Day looks, Championship looks, kit-launch looks, etc. 

>> THE REQUIREMENTS.

3+ years of experience in Figma. 
3+ years of experience in graphic design and mobile UI/UX, particularly for sports.
3+ years of experience in understanding design for the iOS and Android platforms.
Love of designing for sports, including the key milestones in sports, e.g., Draft, free agency, kit launch.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English, including attention to detail, in terms of grammar, spelling, punctuation, vocabulary, and formatting.
Willingness and ability to work the non-traditional hours of the sports industry.

Role Description
We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer and Social Media Coordinator to join our prestigious event and floral design team. The ideal candidate will assist the creative directors in designing visually compelling mood boards and renderings for client presentations, as well as creating stunning event collateral and social media content. Your work will play a key role in elevating our events and translating our luxury design visions into visual assets. 

Key Responsibilities:
Assist creative directors with developing mood boards, concept designs, and renderings for client presentations to help communicate event themes and concepts. 
Design event collateral that aligns with the event’s theme and luxury aesthetic.
Develop visual branding elements for events including logos, color palettes, typography, and custom graphics.
Develop and implement content strategies for platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and Pinterest to enhance our online visibility and engagement.
Stay informed about design trends and social media best practices to continuously improve our content strategy and stay fresh and engaging.
Manage content calendars and design digital marketing materials such as email templates, web banners, and social media graphics.
Conduct content curation, including the creation of stories, graphics, reels, video content, livestreams etc. 
Community engagement on all social media platforms. (Responding to comments on stories, direct messages/inquiries and engaging our following)

Qualifications
Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Creative Suite
Experience in creating engaging social media content
Strong communication skills and attention to detail and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Strong visual storytelling skills with experience in creating mood boards and renderings
Knowledge of current social media trends and best practices
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects in a deadline-driven position

This position is on site Monday-Friday.
Please include your portfolio link with your resume.

BASIC FUNCTION: 
The Graphic Designer will be creating and producing high-quality designs and graphics for on-air, social media, websites, sales presentations, and other various design projects. The designer will also be responsible for helping to elevate and maintain our visual standards. He/she must be accustomed to working within a time-sensitive, team-oriented environment.
 RESPONSIBILITES:
· Create concepts and initial ideas for video advertisements, social media campaigns, marketing strategies, and viewer newsletters.
· Produce and edit web content using WordPress backend.
· Translate provided data into charts and graphs for sales functions and digital marketing efforts.
· Design, develop and help maintain web pages and applications for both the internal and external websites.
· Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a time-sensitive environment.
· Perform retouching and manipulation of images.
· Assist in the creative process by sharing original ideas with the creative team.
· Additional duties as assigned by the Vice President and Sales Managers.
 QUALIFICATIONS:
· Excellent production skills, preflight and file/project organization.
· Excellent oral and written communications skills with strong ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to a wide and diverse audience.
· Expertise in all major business and creative software applications (Adobe Creative Suite, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat, Microsoft Office, etc.).
· 3-5 years of experience with print and digital media.
· Excellent attention to detail.
· Possess a working knowledge of color theory, typography and graphic fundamentals.
· Possess a basic understanding of HTML.
· Comfortable working within a Mac-based environment.
· Must be proactive, accustomed to working under deadlines, coachable, and able to work within established brand guidelines. 
· Strong layout and design skill for both print and web.
· Bachelor’s degree in Design, New Media, Graphic Arts or related field.

jobs.job_title: Mid to Senior Level Graphic Designer
jobs.description:
Hey — 

We’re a design studio in San Diego, California, looking for a full time on-site mid-level designer. 

Ideally, you love creative freedom, pushing boundaries, building your skill set, and working with industry-leading, purpose-driven brands. Hopefully you also like dogs and working within walking distance of the best tacos of your life. 

More details below …

WHAT YOU’LL GET
When we started Bex, we wanted to create the sort of environment we wanted to work in. So we did. And, spoiler, we love it. We think you will, too, and not only because we value talent and we want to foster yours, but because we genuinely like working together. We take projects on as a team and everyone is part of the process. It’s empowering, challenging, and extremely rewarding. It’s also a ton of fun. 

Here are some of the basics + a few extras when it comes to working with us:

Basics— 
• Competitive Salary
• Health & Dental Insurance
• 401k Matching 
• Paid Holidays & Vacation

Extras — 
• Fantastically Creative Projects — You’ll work on a variety of projects from day to day. The best part? Our clients like to push the creative envelope so you’re encouraged to meet them where they’re at.
• Appreciation — We seriously think you’re the best! No kidding. We like to let you know how valued you are, how good your work is, and how great of a job you did. We practice gratitude. 
• Growth as a Designer — Our team is full of individuals with all sorts of different strengths and weaknesses. Together, we get jobs done, supporting one another where it makes sense and doing whatever it takes to get the job done. We have regular creative reviews to provide constructive feedback. 
• Personal Growth — We want to see you grow. We make it part of what we do to help you reach your personal and professional goals. 
• San Diego — You get the best excuse we can think of to move to America’s Finest City. 

WHAT WE NEED
We’re looking for a designer who loves brand ID & packaging and likes to wear a lot of hats. 

Here are the basics + a few extras:

Basics — 
• You have strong conceptual skills
• You have efficient technical skills (particularly InDesign)
• You have a working knowledge of print production
 Extras — 
• Again, you’re going to wear a lot of hats. We all do high-level conceptual work as well as some tedious tasks from time to time. No one is too big or too small to be part of the team. 
• We want to be transparent that sometimes we have deadlines that are tight and sometimes we need you to be able to handle the kind of stress that comes with that. We work hard to make sure timelines are realistic, but sometimes you can’t help what has to be done.

The ideal candidate will have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work which demonstrates their passion for illustrative design and typography for large format print jobs. This candidate will have experiences in working with numerous different design platforms such as digital and print forms. 
 JOB SUMMARY:
This position is responsible for creating and composing large scale digitally printed murals for commercial interior application. Responsible for the complete process, from concept/creation to production ready art/files.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Utilize Adobe Creative Suite software installed on Apple platform
• Ability to work with alpha channels
• Ability to effectively use all tools and layer masks
• Layer management abilities due to large size of files
• Understanding of file requirements for production with raster and vector art
• Ability to work cooperatively as a member of a team as well as independently within the scope of an assignment
• Strong attention to detail, time management and organizational skills
• Establish positive relationships with internal and external customers 
• Utilize a customer-oriented approach, with a positive can do attitude 
• Maintain daily design schedule
• Contribute to team success 


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:
• Strong professionalism
• Excellent communication skills 
• Active listening and problem resolution skills
• Ability to adapt to all internal/external customer styles 
• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
• Prioritization skills 
• Detail oriented, with ability to produce error free work product 
• Ability to work cooperatively as a member of a team
• Excellent attendance, and punctuality
• Ability to perform duties with minimal supervision.
• Ability to take the initiative to resolve a situation, but also has the ability to know when to include management

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
• Student or graduate of college or art school with degree in graphic design or related field

Job Location

Cincinnati

Job Description

P&G’s BeautyHouse, is the in-house, multidisciplinary design studio for beauty brands around the world. We are comprised of a diverse array of skills, backgrounds, and viewpoints. We sit elbow to elbow with Marketing, R&D, Finance, and Package Development to generate a broad spectrum of insights. Our Design Ethos is born from a rebellion against the ordinary, a passionate pursuit of the extraordinary, and an unrelenting devotion to igniting desire through design. We are the constructive disruptors. We ignite the creative spark, serving up thoughtful strategies and captivating experiences that resonate deeply with the outside world. P&G BeautyHouse is looking for a Graphic Designer to join our Beauty Care team.

As a BeautyHouse Graphic Designer within P&G, you will focus on developing a broad range of creative work, consisting of 2D package design, Instore, and digital activation. As a hands-on creative, you will need expertise in the relevant design software to deliver established design concepts to finished executions and an understanding of the creative design process to bring your ideas to life. You will collaborate with other likeminded creatives and multidisciplinary teams to support the business needs.

What You’ll Do

You will build concepts and execute the visual strategy for the brand across consumer touchpoints including packaging, promotional materials, visual communications, eCommerce, social media, etc.
Ensure brand guidelines and directives are embraced consistently and creatively.
Communicate and justify conceptual and directional choices.
Be accountable for excellent execution.

Job Qualifications

BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar field.
2-5 years of full-time design work experience (outside of freelance work).
A portfolio that demonstrates strong Design Mastery in graphic design and brand identity. Your portfolio will be assessed on creative excellence, storytelling, problem-solving and technical mastery.
Must have a Passion for beauty, with an understanding of category trends and the competitive landscape. A keen eye and attention to detail is critical to win in the beauty category.
Uses Empathy and non-linear thinking: Must be able to see the consumer as a person and ideate solutions with the consumer in mind.
Experience in package design with an understanding of basic print feasibility.
Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to justify your conceptional and directional design choices with multi-functional partners. Comfortable giving and receiving feedback.
Flexible in an environment of constant change. Able to engage and influence across functional partners.
Disciplined with superior time and project management skills; possess the ability to set priorities and be accountable.
Expertise in the latest graphics and business programs: Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat) and Microsoft (Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.).

Starting Pay / Salary Range: $85,000 to $115,000

Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits. Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role. For more information regarding who is eligible for hire at P&G along with other work authorization FAQ’s, please click HERE.

Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.

Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114867

Job Segmentation

Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation)

Starting Pay / Salary Range

$85,000.00 - $115,000.00 / year

Graphic Designer | Marketing Department
 Employment Type | Full-Time, Salary non-exempt

Weekly Hours | 40 minimum
 Location: Miami, FL (In-office)
 Company Overview: Join our vibrant team at Sunshine Bouquet, a leading mass market floral company dedicated to bringing joy and beauty to people's lives through our wide range of floral products. As we continue to grow and innovate, we are seeking a talented Graphic Designer to join our creative team and play a crucial role in crafting visually stunning print designs, packaging solutions, and captivating marketing materials.

Position Overview: Sunshine Bouquet Company is looking for a skilled Graphic Designer who specializes in mass print design, packaging, and marketing collateral creation. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, a strong understanding of design principles, and the ability to translate brand identity into engaging visual content. This role requires creativity, technical proficiency, and a passion for delivering high-quality designs that resonate with our target audience.

Key Responsibilities:
• Conceptualize and create compelling print designs for various marketing materials including brochures, flyers, posters, banners, and product packaging.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to develop creative concepts and design solutions that align with brand guidelines and marketing objectives.
• Execute design projects from initial concept to final production, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and adherence to project timelines.
• Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in print design, packaging innovation, and mass market branding to continually elevate the quality of our visual assets.
• Work closely with printers and production vendors to oversee the printing process, ensuring print quality and timely delivery of materials.
• Maintain a cohesive visual identity across all print and packaging materials, maintaining brand consistency and integrity.
• Contribute to brainstorming sessions and idea generation for new product launches, seasonal campaigns, and promotional initiatives.
• Actively participate in design critiques, providing and receiving constructive feedback to enhance design quality and effectiveness.
• Assist with other design projects and tasks as needed, supporting the overall goals of the creative team and the company.
 Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or related field.
• Proven experience (3+ years) in graphic design, with a focus on print design, packaging, and marketing materials in a mass market or consumer goods environment.
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign) and other relevant design software.
• Strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of print design and packaging projects, demonstrating creativity, attention to detail, and a solid understanding of design principles.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners.
• Ability to multitask and prioritize projects in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining high standards of quality and accuracy.
• Knowledge of printing processes, materials, and production techniques, with experience coordinating with print vendors preferred.
• Passion for design, creativity, and a strong desire to contribute to the success of the brand through innovative visual storytelling.
• Photography skills a plus.

BENEFITS | Sunshine Bouquet offers the following benefits to employees, upon the completion of their 90-day probationary period:
 · Medical, Dental and Vision insurance through CIGNA
· Basic life insurance policy (employer paid)
· Choice of various voluntary ancillary benefits
· 401(K) retirement plans with company match
· Vacation time, personal time, and paid holidays.
 * Employees are only eligible for enrollment in Sunshine Bouquet’s medical benefits program 90 days after hire-date.

We are hiring. We are seeking a passionate, efficient, talented individual to join the Graphics Team at Cosabella. Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team. Proactive in problem solving, excellent in time management and communication skills. The Graphic Designer will be responsible for organizing and implementing the creation of digital and print content for both B2C and B2B efforts. This is a Hybrid role. You will work 3 days in the office and 2 days from home. This role requires local candidates within Miami, FL.

If this is you or someone you know, contact me with your resume/ portfolio.
 Responsibilities
1. Develop creative materials for marketing concepts across various platforms, including online marketing, packaging, hangtags, product labels, social media, newsletters, automated email series, home page banners, site banners, and sales materials.

Come join Spotify Advertising, where we focus on connecting brands to billions of fans all over the world. The Ads Design team focuses on delivering the best experience possible for advertisers, listeners, and our internal and external partners across all of our products and markets. In the past year, our team has invested heavily in design quality and scale. We’re looking for a Product Designer who will further transform how we create advertising experiences, and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of advertising on Spotify.

We’re looking for a designer with a passion for building innovative advertising products for advertisers and listeners alike. You’ll partner with the Ads Design team and work closely with the XFN partners and many other teams across Spotify to innovate experiences in one of the highest revenue-driving areas at the company.

What You'll Do

Work on projects across the Spotify Advertising Platform— ad formats, Ads Manager, internal tooling, design systems, machine learning — to develop solutions and ship high-impact features for our customers
Utilize your design craft through concept sketches, storyboards, product mock-ups, high-fidelity prototypes to participate in the product development lifecycle
Think big, but start small — identify both new opportunities and also the first step to exploring them
Work in a variety of modes, from broad explorative prompts to tightly defined launch cycles
Partner closely with product managers, engineers, data scientists and researchers to define next steps as well as long-term strategy
Work with our user research teams to scope and support ongoing research projects
Design solutions focused on inclusivity and accessibility in order to reach users worldwide
Collaborate with other design teams across Spotify working at the intersection of brands and content
Share you work regularly with your immediate peers, as well as participating in design reviews with design and company leadership

Who You Are

You are a Product designer with several years of experience, shipping work to customers
You have experience designing for either business or consumer focused products
You care about design craft and the details that elevate work from good to great
You have consumed design systems in your work
You believe in creating a culture of feedback and actively seek out feedback on your work and approaches
You have 3+ years of relevant design experience

Where You'll Be

We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the United States within the Eastern Standard working hours.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here .

The United States base range for this position is $112,298 - $160,425, plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays. These ranges may be modified in the future.

#JobSite-Main-Design

jobs.job_title: Visual UI Designer, Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) Alexa Information with verification
jobs.description:
Description

Join Amazon's innovative AGI Alexa Information team and shape the future of AI experiences. As a Visual UI Designer, you'll create cutting-edge user interfaces for our cloud-based intelligent voice assistant, Alexa, and contribute to high-profile consumer experiences.

At Amazon, we're at the forefront of transformative AI, pioneering state-of-the-art AI and machine learning models to enhance customer experiences worldwide. We're entering a new era where AI promises to reshape society and business in unprecedented ways. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with our world-class team of AI experts and unlock the next frontiers of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).

The AGI Alexa Information team is seeking a Visual UI Designer to elevate AI experiences through high-quality UI creation. We value attention to detailed aesthetics for flexible and dynamic user interfaces across web and mobile platforms. Our focus is on designing and delivering widely-adopted consumer internet products that make a difference in people's lives.

Key job responsibilities

 Visualize experiences in the abstract, build consensus, and drive that vision into concise design deliverables
 Foster a customer-focused design culture by sharing best practices and influencing product strategy
 Use systems-level design thinking to drive scalable design solutions
 Present design work to executive leadership and other stakeholders
 You will be a tastemaker and visual storyteller, and advocate for design excellence to create meaningful connections between customers and our products

A day in the life

In this role, you'll design intuitive and engaging user interfaces that bridge the gap between advanced AI technology and everyday users. You will work hands-on with a talented team of designers, applying your understanding of visual systems and best practices. You will collaborate cross-functionally to drive elegant design solutions from early concept through final implementation. You will share ideas and receive feedback in a supportive, inclusive environment, and contribute to the development of innovative AI-driven user experience. Your work will directly impact customers who interact with Alexa through various devices, including Kindle eReaders, Fire Tablets, Echo devices, and more.

About The Team

The Amazon AGI team designs and engineers Amazon’s cutting edge AI models and experience that help drive our high-profile consumer electronic experiences, including Kindle eReaders, Fire tablets, Fire TV, Echo, Ring, Blink, Eero, Halo, Kuiper and Zoox. We also power Alexa, a cloud-based intelligent voice assistant, to provide information, answer questions, play music, control your smart home and much more. Alexa is integrated into many of our products and partner products and many thousands of devices work with Alexa.

Basic Qualifications

 5+ years of design experience
 3+ years of delivering design solutions as a UX designer or interaction designer experience
 Knowledge of and proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or Sketch
 An online portfolio that demonstrates visual craft, vision storytelling, and design systems thinking, demonstrated evidence of shipping world-class customer experiences
 A strong understanding of visual systems and best practices, including layout, color palette, typography, iconography and illustrations.
 An understanding of design thinking methodologies to help teams align on user-centered outcomes
 A deep commitment to visual craft and product excellence
 A bias for action in developing new products from inception to launch
 Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs

Preferred Qualifications

 2+ years of mass-market consumer web / mobile products experience
 Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with developers for implementation of designs

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company’s reputation. Pursuant to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $106,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $184,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2823172

Job ID: A2823172

A designer at Simply Organic Beauty must aspire to be more than a pixel-pusher. We are looking for a creative teammate to help enhance our visual branding, support our mission to bring clean beauty to every salon, and create beautiful content we're proud of. 

The ideal candidate will have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work which demonstrates their passion for illustrative design and typography. This candidate will have experience in working with numerous different design platforms such as digital marketing, advertising and print.

Department: Marketing, reporting to the VP of Marketing.
Hours: Monday - Friday, 9am - 6pm (Hybrid work schedule)

Responsibilities:
Create compelling and effective visual identity, digital, print and packaging designs. 
Explore creative solutions and concepts that are visually inspiring and conceptually sound based on project briefs provided by marketing.
Collaborate with the team to ensure consistency of designs across various media outlets.
Maintain awareness of current industry and technology standards, social media, competitive landscape and market trends.
Frequently share your ideas and opinions internally to constantly evolve and enhance our brand and company vision.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Graphic Design or related field.
2-4 years of experience in Graphic Design and portfolio of work required.
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.
Strong understanding of design principles for type, shape, color and photography.
Experience in illustration, photo retouching and/ or front-end development is a bonus.
Strong communication, conceptual thinking, typography skills and design skills
Must be able to understand the production possibilities and excel at time management and prioritization of projects.
Must be a team player, collaborator, and feel comfortable leading design exploration, concepting and execution based on creative ideas and concepts.
Bachelor's Degree in Graphic Design or similar.

Company Benefits:
401k Retirement Plan and Employer Match Incentive Program.
Monthly FREE product allowance.
Health, Vision and Dental Insurance included. AFLAC supplemental plans are also available (optional).
Generous, company-wide bonus structure and incentives.
Complimentary on-site snacks and refreshments.
Mandatory Birthday Paid Time Off.

Sr. Graphic Designer

Memorial Products is a fast growing family owned business located in Cranston, RI providing print and design services for the funeral services industry. We have been in business for over 20 years helping funeral homes create meaningful tributes that celebrate and honor the families they serve. The company was built upon delivering high quality products and great customer service to the funeral homes that we serve. We produce a wide variety of printed materials such as high-end prayer cards, thank you cards, register books, and marketing related materials to support our customers and the families they serve.

We are currently in search of a full time Sr. Graphic Designer with proofreading experience with a strong background in Adobe Suite, Indesign and Google Suite (Gmail, Google Sheets). Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast paced, tight deadline environment with a goal of providing our customers quick, accurate proofs and printed materials. A meticulous eye is needed to ensure that products are guided through the proofing process, printed, produced, and packaged for shipping while meeting our QA standards. A strong sense of typography and composition are a must. We are looking for someone who works with a sense of urgency and is willing to learn about our business, customers and process to add value across all aspects of the design and production process.

Primary responsibilities would include:
Reviewing artwork and copy for grammatical and spelling errors
Ensuring accuracy in artwork development, trafficking, printing, packaging and shipping
Assisting with order entry and other quality control related projects
Quality Control Management for design development, production and shipping
Leveraging your background in Graphic Design to ensure aesthetic and Photo editing meets our standards
You have experience with basic photo editing/retouching/manipulation skills
Strong sense of typography and composition

Qualifications:
Strong communication skills regarding design and customer service
Ability to work both independently and with a team
Strong Attention to Detail
5+ years experience with Adobe CS with focus on Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator
3+ years experience as a Graphic Designer or Pre-Press or similar position

Nice to have:
Ripping/Printing files using Fiery EFI software

jobs.job_title: Senior Graphic Designer, Men's Global Football Apparel with verification
jobs.description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

NIKE, Inc. designs the future. At NIKE, Inc. designers chase their curiosities and build what's next, shaping the culture and advancing human potential. The Design teams include artists, inventors and specialists, all with different focuses, including color and material experts, and apparel, footwear and graphic designers. Nike designers look to the future, aggressively pursuing materials, ideas and forms that further elevate the athlete experience, raise the bar for modern style and reduce environmental impact.

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

We're currently looking for a Sr Product Graphic Designer to contribute to the vision of Nike Global Football. Our team works on highly visible product across Global Federations, Clubs, and NWSL. We support these teams with bespoke collections comprised of game day, training and lifestyle product. This is where sport, design and culture meet and where we are redefining apparel for both athletes and fans.

This role requires a high level of passion and creativity, along with the versatility and focus to contribute to graphic direction and strategy through the product creation process. Our work comes to life on the world's biggest stages. It takes a dedicated leader and teammate that knows how to collaborate and translate sophisticated insights into authentic narratives, while driving design solutions that elevate the future of sport apparel at Nike.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

Groundbreaking, innovative Nike design. Concepting and building out narratives that will inspire and influence Jersey designs while incorporating our partner's team identities. To accomplish this, you will collaborate with your design, development and business partners to ensure all details are recorded and delivered as presented. From Trims to print applications and cost considerations you will be challenged by a wide range of responsibilities and experiences.

Accountabilities include but are not limited to, influencing teams, speaking with athletes* and contributing to the creative vision of Nike Global Football. Leading team meetings and cascading critical information to ensure the project hits all deadlines. Presenting design concepts and seasonal initiatives to internal and external audiences while always keeping to Nike's best interests.

WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?

You will be driving graphic strategy and vision while working with multiple teams of designers, developers, and product managers to deliver creative in line with the Nike Design Ethos. This opportunity will require strong collaborative skills to meet deadlines, ensure feasibility of designs, hit price points, while talking your partners through the thinking behind your work.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING?

Bachelor's degree in graphic design, apparel design or related design field, or equivalent combination of relevant education, experience, and training
5+ years relevant work experience in Graphic Design, Color Design, or Product Design
Passion and understanding of current and emerging design trends and visual culture
Ability to translate insights into authentic narratives and visual storytelling
Ability to adapt to change and handle multiple, competing priorities
Strong visual and verbal communication skills, able to effectively present design intent to internal and external audiences
Proficient in sketching, illustration, typography, print and pattern, color theory and layout
Knowledge of apparel product creation
Proficient in Adobe CC and comfortable working within new digital spaces
Ability to embrace diverse points of view while fostering an environment of inclusivity
Passion for empowering our Athletes/Teams and making their dreams come true

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

jobs.job_title: Senior Graphics Engineer - BigBox with verification
jobs.description:
You are a talented Graphics Engineer looking to build the next generation of games for VR. You have multiple years of experience with the Unity Editor (or other 3D game engines like Unreal) and can push pixels and perfect pipelines.

Senior Graphics Engineer - BigBox Responsibilities:

Collaborating with artists, designers, and other engineers to design, research, innovate, and implement rendering technologies and feature sets
Work closely with technical artists to create highly-productive content workflows
Extensive profiling and optimization experience
Passion for graphics programming and staying on top of current technologies
Strong communicator who loves the iterative technical and creative process
Desire to understand a product holistically and contribute creatively
Know when to be pragmatic and when to be blue sky
Make engineering trade-offs that align with business objectives
Must embrace teamwork, as well as solve problems independently

Minimum Qualifications:

8+ years professional experience in software development
5+ years professional experience in Unity
Experience with DX11, HLSL, GLSL, ShaderLab, and Shader Graph
Extensive GPU programming and Shader experience
Experience developing tools and workflows
Proficiency in developing objected-oriented software, with proven experience in one or more relevant languages (C++ or C#)
Experience with the entire development life-cycle from concept to launching

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AR or VR
Experience working on mobile graphics chipsets

Must-haves 
* 3+ years of financial and/or data analytics experience with a financial institution 
 * Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business or a related field - or related work experience 
 * Ability to analyze and manipulate large quantities of data with great attention to detail as well as understand the flow of data within database applications 

Plusses 
* Regulatory Reporting, Liquidity Management, Accounting, Data Management or similar background/experience 
 * SQL, Database knowledge & ability to analyze data and related flows 
 * Experience working with quantitative models 
 * Knowledge of Banking and Capital market products 
 * Experience with Microsoft Suite -- Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Workiva, Atlas/LIBRA, Blueprint, Diamond, Tableau 

Day-to-Day 
- Insight Global is looking for a Financial Data Analyst for a large financial services client in the Charlotte, NC area. This role is going to be working in the Global Liquidity Management group, and working heavily with data needed for 2052 A reporting. This person needs to be skilled in both Excel and Tableau and needs to be interested in working with large sets of data to provide update and communicate with other lines of business within the bank. This individual will be presenting to upper management on errors within their data. This person will be starting in their data quality space, move into a validation role, followed by more a role with heavy reporting and communication with business leaders. This team is referred to as their Production Team, and this person will rotate between these groups on a weekly basis. The Analyst will be responsible for: 
 * Daily/weekly/monthly reporting of liquidity metrics (regulatory and internal), including analysis and investigation of moves 
 * Liaising with internal colleagues, 2nd and 3rd line defense teams to streamline reporting and ensure resolution of issues 
 * Project Work -- involving a wide scope of possibilities but mainly focused on improved design and control within existing reporting routines

The Financial Analyst is a key contributor who will support financial analysis goals by helping to implement effective financial procedures and processes. This role involves assisting in the preparation of budgets, business plans, and financial evaluations through report generation, data management, and systems support.
 Duties and Responsibilities: 

Oversee annual budget processes and related forecasting activities. 
Assist with analytical tasks within business units, ensuring accuracy and compliance with internal controls, GAAP, and regulatory standards. 
Support the monthly inventory process by managing and maintaining inventory accounts for accuracy. 
Help resolve operational and tactical issues as they arise. 
Record intercompany transactions, assist with credit card reconciliations, and complete other month-end responsibilities. 
Monitor overhead expenses and identify potential resource mismanagement. 
Collaborate with global finance departments. 
Participate in lean initiatives and continuous improvement processes to prevent future discrepancies. 
Address inquiries regarding department programs. 
Partner with various departments to aid in the development and allocation of their budgets. 
Navigate and evaluate multiple systems containing financial data. 
Perform additional duties as required.
  Preferred Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a related field is preferred. 
1-5+ years of relevant experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
MBA or CMA certification is preferred.

Competencies: 

Strong understanding of technical, process, and business principles, along with industry practices and standards. 
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills. 
Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively. 
High integrity and discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information. 
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. 
Knowledge of GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles) and Sarbanes-Oxley regulations.

When you join Verizon

You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life.

What You’ll Be Doing...

The Payments Analyst works with customer payments, payment application, research, returns and escheatment. This role handles escalations of customer requests related to unapplied and/or misapplied payments.

Utilize various systems and subledgers to research payment application.
Assist with developing solutions to payment problems and testing the accuracy of system enhancements designed to accommodate these solutions.
Develop and document process changes to improve the quality and efficiency of the operation.

What We’re Looking For...

You are detail oriented and approach work with a process mindset. You develop transformative solutions to improve functions.

You’ll Need To Have

Bachelor's degree or one or more years of work experience.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

A degree in Finance, Accounting or Business.
Understanding and/or working knowledge of Verizon billing and payment systems.
Understanding of payment types (check, ACH, EDI, Credit Card, etc) and the rules for each.
Experience in the payment industry.
Competent knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office products and financial system programs.
Possess the ability to work under pressure and maintain a calm focus during hectic periods.
Possess strong positive interpersonal, communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently or in a group, functioning in a multi-task and fast-paced environment.

If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

Where you’ll be working

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

Senior Accountant / Financial Analyst

We are seeking a Senior Accountant / Financial Analyst with a manufacturing company background for eLoghomes, a national marketer and producer of log home kits. The position is based at our corporate office in Battleboro, NC. This is a fast growing company with a differentiated approach to sales, marketing, and installation service vs. the industry. The primary responsibilities of the role will be to assist with month end close, create reporting for Key Performance Indicators across the business, and serve as a business partner to each of the team leaders in analysis of their functional area. This position will also include working cross functionally with the VP of Operations to identify, track and monitor cost allocations, costing of materials, inventory analysis, and support the production scheduling / analysis as needed.
The position reports to the VP of Finance / Controller. The ideal candidate will possess a bachelor's degree in accounting or finance and at least three years of corporate or public accounting experience and is looking for an opportunity to grow their skillset and advance his/her career. This onsite role will lead the accounting and/or FP&A duties in a fast-paced environment using key skills such as Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Balance Sheet Reconciliations, General Ledger Journal Entries, Month End Close, financial analysis, and forward looking financial projections. The ideal candidate will demonstrate high growth potential with a strong desire to learn. Training will be provided.

Key responsibilities include:
Reconciling G/L accounts, preparing supporting schedules, posting adjusting journal entries, variance analysis, and preparing monthly financial and KPI reporting / dashboard packages
Work with the leadership team on ad-hoc analysis to analyze trends in the business and provide insights for financial forecasts and modeling
Inventory analysis, coordinate the physical inventory / cycle count processes, ensuring accuracy
Analyze and streamline various processes across the business with an emphasis on continuous productivity improvement
Participate in the setup and implementation of the new ERP system

Other tasks:
Proficient in Accounts Payable (AP) and Accounts Receivable (AR)
Update and track status of each job order (billings vs payments)
Monthly sales tax filings and property tax filings
Streamline the process for calculating payments for sales commission program on an ongoing basis
Other duties and projects as assigned

Qualifications include:
4-year degree with a concentration in accounting or related field
Advanced Excel skills including creating formula driven financial analysis spreadsheets is required
Knowledge of US GAAP and accrual based accounting
Team player & strong work ethic
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office programs
Experience using ERP systems
Experience handling external and internal audit is a plus
Familiarity of the COSO Framework and internal controls is a plus but training will be provided
Familiarity with ASC606 is a plus but training will be provided
Experience as a cost accountant in a manufacturing company is a plus but training will be provided
Root cause analysis, FP&A, lean manufacturing, and / or 5S experience is a plus but training will be provided
Position may require lifting up to 25 lbs.

About the company:
eLoghomes is a fast-growing log home package manufacturer, and offers construction services to our customers through a network of specialized builders that work with us. The company sells packages and installs nationally. We offer competitive salary and benefits, and the ability to work in a fun log home work environment!

eLoghomes is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

OUR MISSION STATEMENT:
The Adirondack Trust Company's objective is to maintain and enhance our public image as a high quality, professional, ethical, and friendly place to conduct business. The Adirondack Trust Company's ability to prosper and grow as an independent financial services company is directly related to our reputation, maintaining a high level of public confidence and properly servicing the financial needs of our market area.
GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
A seasoned commercial credit analyst that underwrites and monitors large and/or more complicated commercial loan relationships. Prepares loan portfolio management reports, and performs various administration duties in support of the Commercial Loan Portfolio. Meets with Commercial Loan Officers independently to discuss issues and ask questions. Applicants must be willing to perform all necessary job functions and uphold all customer confidentiality. May provide day-to-day supervision and support of lower level analysts.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prepares credit approval memorandums for larger and more complicated commercial loan relationships, analyzing their financial statements, business, cash flow capacity, collateral, adherence to loan policy, etc.. to ensure proper credit decision and accurate risk ratings.
Spread more complicated commercial borrowers’ business/personal financial statements on the bank’s standard spreading software and according to established Bank procedures.
Performs analysis of a guarantor’s financial position to develop an understanding of any contingent liabilities and cash flow.
Complete annual reviews of assigned commercial loan relationships to ensure current information in credit file and accurate risk ratings.
Performs real estate appraisal reviews with supervision.
Complete annual reviews of assigned commercial loan relationships to ensure current information in credit file and accurate risk ratings.
Develops written analysis of the Company’s vendors/municipalities.
Participates in special projects/duties as assigned.
Attends training as needed.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Exercises a high level of review authority over own work and over the work of less experienced staff. Coaches, trains, and educates less experienced staff in credit analysis, documentation, financial analysis, and research techniques as well as departmental and Company policies, processes and systems.
QUALIFICATIONS:
4-Year College degree (two semesters of accounting preferred), or equivalent combination of course work and work experience.
5 - 7 years Commercial Credit/Lending experience.
Strong communication, written and analytical skills
Strong PC Skills (Spreadsheet and Word Processing)
Good interpersonal skills and customer service skills, and a team orientation.
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and under deadlines, and able to prioritize effectively.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize conflicting demands.

About ServiceCore: 

ServiceCore is a rapidly-growing field-service Software as a Service platform for the portable sanitation and dumpster industries, being named the #69th fastest growing software company in America by Inc. 5,000. The customers we serve have been severely underserved by prior software providers, making us the leading player in a huge industry with very little competition. Our software helps our incredibly hard-working business owners get more done and stress less. How? By supercharging their businesses with software that cuts wasted time, manages jobs, optimizes routes, tracks inventory, and automates billing. We are proud to offer a one-stop solution that allows our hard-working customers to be more productive and successful!

We live by our core values of Love Our Customers, Be Real, Give a Shit, Deliver Results and of course Keep it Fun. ServiceCore provides hard-working individuals the opportunity to work and grow within an agile, fast-paced start-up environment. We are proud of our accomplishments and take our jobs seriously while not taking ourselves too seriously. 

Role Overview:

ServiceCore is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Financial Analyst to join our finance team. Reporting to the Senior Finance Manager, this role will support strategic decision-making by delivering insights into financial performance, analyzing key SaaS metrics, and guiding business growth through data-driven recommendations. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, a keen understanding of SaaS financial models, a can-do work ethic, and the ability to work collaboratively across departments. This role provides significant growth potential, allowing you to expand your responsibilities and advance your career in a dynamic SaaS environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and analyze monthly SaaS metrics including annual recurring revenue waterfall, retention rates, cohorts, customer lifetime value, and customer acquisition cost
Conduct variance analysis to compare actual results against budget and forecast, identifying trends and providing actionable insights
Support the Senior Finance Manager in the budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning process
Prepare and deliver financial reports, dashboards, and presentations for senior leadership and investors
Partner with department leaders including Sales, Payments, and Customer Experience to provide insights on key business activities and drive retention
Develop and maintain financial models to assess company performance and support business initiatives
Support ad-hoc financial analysis and special projects as required to drive company growth and efficiency improvements

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. CPA preferred
3-6 years of experience in financial analysis, preferably in a SaaS or technology company
Strong proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis, with advanced skills in Excel
In-depth understanding of SaaS metrics and revenue recognition principles
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders
Positive, can-do attitude, with the desire to learn and grow
Desire to be part of a company culture that lives by its Core Values - Love Our Customers, Be Real, Give a Shit, Deliver Results, and Keep it Fun

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive annual salary between $110K - $125K, commensurate with experience
12 Company Holidays in addition to unlimited PTO 
Healthcare, dental and vision insurance
401K match
New computer, top tier hardware
Weekly lunches and stocked kitchen
Regular company events and happy hours
A strong company culture that lives by our Core Values - Love Our Customers, Be Real, Give a Shit, Deliver Results, and Keep it Fun

ServiceCore is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

If you are a motivated, experienced Finance professional looking to grow quickly, this is an exciting opportunity to support the future of Finance at ServiceCore. We look forward to reviewing your application.

At PCA, we say, "It's not just the cars, it's the people!" We have amazing staff who love to work at PCA, and it's time to add our next team member. This is a great job and a great place to work!

TO APPLY: Please provide a RESUME and COVER LETTER.
Applications without a cover letter will not be considered complete. (If unable to submit through LinkedIn, you may send to admin@pca.org.)

ABOUT US
Porsche Club of America (www.pca.org) is a club for Porsche owners. With approximately 160,000 members across the US and Canada, PCA is the largest single-marque car club in the world. The National Office staff support 148 regions (chapters) and national programs in a variety of ways: processing memberships, planning events, bringing support to driving, racing and educational programs, producing a monthly magazine, and much more.

POSITION SUMMARY
The Senior Financial Accountant/Analyst will perform complex general ledger and financial reporting processes within the accounts payable, accounts receivable, banking and inventory functions using QuickBooks software. The position will work directly with the Comptroller. Confidentiality is essential and a background check will be required. PCA is a 501(c)7 nonprofit.

Location: PCA National Office is located in Columbia, MD.

Responsibilities/ Essential Duties:
Prepare segment financial statements, analysis and notes.
Work with segment leaders and key people to prepare and explain annual budgets and forecasts.
Prepare and record asset, liability, revenue, and expense transactions into QuickBooks.
Process monthly advertising invoice and collection recording.
Prepare monthly bank account and general ledger reconciliation.
Process expense reports and vendor payments in a timely manner.
File quarterly MD sales tax
Respond to audit and regulatory tax requests as needed.

Qualifications
In depth knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) with a minimum of 2 – 3 years financial accounting experience.
Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related finance field required. CPA or MBA in Finance preferred.
Advanced MS Excel skills with emphasis on financial statement workbook modeling.
Proficient in using QuickBooks or similar accounting software.
Excellent organizational skills
Strong analytical, problem solving, verbal and written communication skills

Benefits and Compensation:
Salary: $76k-$78k, based on experience
Paid time off; personal time, vacation and holidays
Simple IRA Retirement Savings Plan (partial co. match after eligibility period)
Health insurance plan (partial contribution after eligibility period)

jobs.job_title: Senior Financial Analyst, Robotics with verification
jobs.description:
Description

Interested in robotics and automation? Want to work on building and deploying technologies that don't exist anywhere else in the world? Eager to explore the complexities of global supply chains and how things get made? We are growing a team to support our Design for Scale group, which helps deploy automation across the Amazon supply chain.

Our Finance team is currently seeking a Senior Financial Analyst with a proven ability to work within a dynamic environment and partner with senior leadership to achieve their goals. This role will partner with our supply chain and logistics teams to support decision making, scale new products and systems, and drive efficiency.

This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment, demonstrate an understanding of core finance and accounting principles, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Amazon is fast-growing, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously.

As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will collaborate directly with key business stakeholders to provide performance insights, support strategic decision making and planning, develop and maintain financial models evaluating opportunities, and provide recommendations based on data. You will also identify opportunities for efficiency and cost savings across the organization.

Key job responsibilities

 Perform detailed financial analysis on key initiatives and proposals
 Establish, invent, and maintain operating and business metrics to evaluate performance and efficiency
 Lead short and long-term financial planning and budgeting for your space
 Act as a controller on spending proposals and ensure the team is meeting their plan
 Use the expertise in the collection, analysis and management of quantitative financial data, creating reports for month end close analysis and financial forecasts
 Controllership will be your top priority. You will work with multiple data sources and will identify basic control risks, evaluate impact, propose changes, and implement improvements to remediate gaps
 Manage monthly and quarterly forecast for both Opex/Capex and headcount
 Partner and influence the stakeholders on the definition of strategic management of HC
 Provide insights for monthly and quarterly business reviews on a timely manner
 Monitor forecast accuracy, understand drivers of variances, and provide insightful commentary & analysis for both current period and future periods
 Partner with your business teams, and lead the developing of monthly financial close activities, planning, and reporting models while overseeing their continuous innovation and communication to your business partners
 Perform ad-hoc business analyses, and financial modeling. Present recommendations to senior management on strategic decisions, and planned future initiatives
 Demonstrate appropriate understanding/working knowledge of accounting principles and internal controls
 Identify opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes; lead projects to execute on those opportunities

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, or a related analytical field (e.g., engineering, math, computer science)
 3+ years of finance or a related analytical field experience

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience performing ad hoc analysis using advanced Excel

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $60,200/year in our lowest geographic market up to $128,800/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Job Summary

Support strategies to help drive increased profitability, process efficiency, reduce costs and overall business improvement. Partner with leadership to deliver financial and strategic results through the utilization of Financial Planning & Analysis of best practices. Support corporate FP&A (financial planning & analysis) processes, initiatives and reporting within Operations.

Responsibilities

Facilitate Annual Operating Plan (AOP) process and tools within the Region
Support Region management in preparation of the monthly business review for corporate
Support Region management in the preparation of the quarterly Business Review
Support the Region finance team is the monthly close process
Collaborate with Sysco Business Services in the monthly process to ensure a timely accurate close
Develop, and deploy tools and processes across the organization as business defines
Perform customer incentive analysis and propose recommendations
Provide support cross-functionally with all departments on both local and corporate initiatives
Financial modeling and ad hoc analytics
Perform other duties as assigned

Education

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance required
MBA Degree 

Experience

1+ years of Financial or business-related analysis experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Professional Skills

Strong analytical, organizational, interpersonal skills and broad knowledge of accounting principles, practices, and procedures
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to deal with a diverse group of people
Must be able to work on multiple projects concurrently and capable of working with little direct supervision

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, and considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.

This opportunity is available through Sysco Corporation, its subsidiaries and affiliates.
